title: Press Room | Aktualności | Parlament Europejski
text:
ENVI
The new rules will make the EU food system more secure and sustainable, with climate- and pest-resistant plants that give higher yields and require fewer fertilisers and pesticides.
The new rules will make the EU food system more secure and sustainable, with climate- and pest-resistant plants that give higher yields and require fewer fertilisers and pesticides.
Changes to the 2024 Asylum Law regarding the conditions for applying the rules on safe non-EU countries were endorsed by the Civil Liberties Committee on Wednesday.
The European Parliament’s Civil Liberties Committee adopted its preferred candidates for the post of European Chief Prosecutor.
An update of the EU asylum law to include an EU list of safe countries of origin and speed up asylum claim processing has been endorsed by the Civil Liberties Committee.
To make it quicker for travellers to cross EU external borders, while ensuring border security, MEPs have endorsed the use of digital travel credentials.
Draft legislation informally agreed with the Council seeks to protect the EU’s interests from the weaponisation of energy supplies by the Russian Federation.
Parliament has struck a deal with Council on updating protection rules for package holidaymakers, based on lessons learned from the pandemic and high-profile bankruptcies.
MEPs secured new EU measures for the more effective prevention and prosecution of corruption, including reinforced cooperation and greater transparency.
During a visit to Nicosia, President Metsola and EP political group leaders laid the groundwork for effective cooperation ahead of the Cyprus Presidency of the Council from 1 January 2026.
On Monday, Parliament and Council negotiators reached a provisional agreement on revised rules for the EU’s preferential trade arrangement with developing countries.
European Parliament President Roberta Metsola and political group leaders will visit Nicosia on 1-2 December ahead of the upcoming Cypriot Presidency of the Council of the European Union.
On Thursday, Parliament adopted resolutions on the human rights situation in Tanzania, Iran and Tunisia.
W czwartek Parlament wezwał UE do przyjęcia większej odpowiedzialności za bezpieczeństwo europejskie i do jak najbardziej proaktywnego wspierania pokoju na Ukrainie.
On Thursday, Parliament adopted its priorities for the EU’s strategy for the rights of persons with disabilities beyond 2024.
The new rules aim to enhance transparency and democratic accountability in third-country interest representation without restricting legitimate civic engagement.
od 01 do 04 grudnia 2025
Skontaktuj się z pracownikami mediów Parlamentu Europejskiego, aby uzyskać pomoc w zakresie usług medialnych, zapytań prasowych lub informacji na temat działalności parlamentarnej.
Zwróć się o akredytację prasową i specjalne zezwolenia na nagrywanie w pomieszczeniach Parlamentu Europejskiego.
Wybierz interesujące cię tematy i formaty i otrzymuj najnowsze wiadomości bezpośrednio z Parlamentu Europejskiego.
a także transmisje na żywo, konferencje prasowe, nagrania wideo i zdjęcia z sesji plenarnych, posiedzeń komisji i ważnych wydarzeń parlamentarnych.
Wsparcie audiowizualne Parlamentu dla mediów: stanowiska do nagrywania, studia, usługi satelitarne, zespoły ekspertów itp.
Dowiedz się, jak UE wspiera finansowo projekty medialne i działania promujące wolność prasy i demokrację.
